abstract: Our daily roundup of Web gems includes a brain-controlled computer, the one person that Conan O’Brien follows on Twitter and a new site that broadcasts your purchase history to your followers.
snippet: Our daily roundup of Web gems includes a brain-controlled computer, the one person that Conan O’Brien follows on Twitter and a new site that broadcasts your purchase history to your followers.
lead_paragraph: Monday’s roundup of interesting items from around the Web, selected by the technology reporters and editors of The New York Times:

headline.main: What We’re Reading: Conan’s Twitter Buddy and New York in Pixels

abstract: Charles Thacker, the lead designer on the Alto, the Xerox PARC prototype of the modern personal computer, won the Turing Award.
snippet: Charles Thacker, the lead designer on the Alto, the Xerox PARC prototype of the modern personal computer, won the Turing Award.
lead_paragraph: This is the big week for awards — in computing as well as movies. The Turing Award, often called the Nobel prize of computer science, was announced on Tuesday and the 2009 winner was Charles P. Thacker.

headline.main: A Talk With Charles Thacker, the Turing Winner
